t: A maskil of David. When he was in the cave. A prayer.
I*pn cry aloud to the Lord;*s I*ld lift up my voice to the Lord*s for mercy.
I*ln pour out before him my complaint; before*ld him I tell my trouble.
When*pn my spirit grows faint within me, it*ld is you who watch over my way. In*ln the path where I walk people*ld have hidden a snare for me.
Look*ln and see, there is no one at my right hand; no*ld one is concerned for me. I*ln have no refuge; no*ld one cares for my life.
I*pn cry to you, Lord;*s I*ld say, “You are my refuge, my*ld portion in the land of the living.”
Listen*pn to my cry, for*ld I am in desperate need; rescue*ln me from those who pursue me, for*ld they are too strong for me.
Set*ln me free from my prison, that*ld I may praise your name. Then*ln the righteous will gather about me because*ld of your goodness to me.
